rComments: Prof. Gilbert was my faculty advisor for my internship. He has been extremely helpful and approachable. I've talked to him several time during office hours and he always has great suggestions for my project and some wonderful stories. He has done a lot of work in the tropics of the Americas and his SCWIBLES work is very inspiring!!!!

Greg was my most inspiring professor ever when I was in his Tropical Ecology class in 2003. He cares so much about his subject matter and his students, and it shows. He was choked up on the last day of class because he was going to miss us all. Really learned a lot, and loved the class. He invited me to take a grad seminar with him the next year.

Like Greg said in the beginning of the quarter, "this class isn't about pictures of furry animals" (though there were some pretty cool pictures!). Weekly online quizzes and group essays were designed to make you do the reading and engage with the text. A pretty good work load though this class is definitely worth it.
good class, interesting subject matter. Greg is very enthusiastic about the tropics. Enjoyed the class.

Professor Gilbert gives a lot of work to do in the class with weekly readings and group essays. However, his grading system is pretty fair and fairly easy to achieve a good grade. Much of this class was based on how much work you put into the class. Midterm & Finals were 15% each. Interesting lectures and guest speakers. I had fun

greg was not there for over half the quarter due to illness. this did not stop him from giving a really hard midterm (mean was about 45%) and assigning a lengthy paper (about 15-18 pages). the class was interesting, but there was also lots of busy work. greg knows his stuff about fungus.
Greg is great, really nice and helpful if you come to his office hours. however, he won't be teaching 100 anymore. Bury and Zavaleta are great teachers too.

Gerg didn't do all the lectures. We actually had quite a few guest lectures which I thought were really the best part of the class along with the assoc. writing lab.  Greg's a really nice guy and made me laugh with the way he bounces as he walks. He cried on the last day of class, which was really sweet.  The class was co-taught with Sarah Rabkin.
